installed_cost_source.notes: $25/kBtu/h cost premium (Table 3 in BTO MYPP) relative to best in market residential air source heat pump (see notes below Table 3 in BTO MYPP) + baseline cost of $68/kBtu/h ($5100 total installed cost / 75 kBtu/h typical capacity, from EIA data for 2020 'typical' residential air source heat pumps) * 75 kBtu/h typical capacity per unit (from EIA data)

market_scaling_fractions_source.heating: Applies to all residential gas heating; no electric heating is switched by this ECM

cooling.title: RECS 2015 - Tables HC6.1 and HC7.1
cooling.fraction_derivation: Cooling multiple of 54.2% was determined as a proportion of total cooled homes where heating is done using natural gas from RECS 2015 microdata. Total cooled homes in the sample was found to be 103,100,000, and then filtered for square footage where natural gas is used for heating 55,900,000.

_description: Air source heat pump for application in residential buildings in colder climates
